intro: Streblus glaber subsp. australiensis, commonly known as the Australian sandpaper fig, is a small to medium-sized tree native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its rough, bark-like foliage, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. This species is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and adaptability.
